medical_history.chief_complaint: Skin lesions, anemia, thrombocytosis, and elevated blood alkaline phosphatase level.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 5 months before presentation with a painful erythematous papule on the chin, followed by fever and more papules developing into plaques. Skin lesions waxed and waned. A week after initial symptoms, new lesions developed on the forearms. After multiple treatments, the lesions decreased in size but remained painful. The course of symptoms included episodic vulvo-vaginal ulcers that waxed and waned.
medical_history.family_history: Father has diabetes mellitus; mother has hypertension and polymyalgia rheumatica.
medical_history.social_history: Travels abroad frequently; sexually active with one partner, who used condoms.
